trans-unit.source: Represents a Windows control that enables the user to select a date using a visual monthly calendar display.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar> control allows the user to select a date using a visual display.
You can limit the date and times that can be selected by setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.MinDate%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.MaxDate%2A> properties.

You can change the look of the calendar portion of the control by setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ForeColor%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Font%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.TitleBackColor%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.TitleForeColor%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.TrailingForeColor%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.BackColor%2A> properties.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DateTimePicker> control only supports Gregorian calendars.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DateTimePicker> control only supports Gregorian calendars.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar> control is drawn by the operating system, so the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.Paint> event is never raised.

If you need to provide a customized look to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar> control, you should override the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.OnPrint%2A> method, call the base implementation of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.OnPrint%2A>, and then perform custom painting.

If you need custom date formatting and a selection limited to just one date, you might consider using a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DateTimePicker> control instead of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar>.
Using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DateTimePicker> eliminates much of the need for validating date/time values.
For more information on month calendar controls, see [Month Calendar Control Reference](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=178863).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar"></xref> class.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.%23ctor%2A> constructor creates a new <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar>.
The following table shows initial property values for an instance of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar> class.
Item
Description
Today's date.
Today's date.
Adds a day that is displayed in bold on an annual basis in the month calendar.
You must call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.UpdateBoldedDates%2A> method afterward to update the display.
To add multiple dates in a single assignment, you can assign an array of <xref:System.DateTime> objects to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.AnnuallyBoldedDates%2A> property.
The date to be displayed in bold.
Adds a day to be displayed in bold in the month calendar.
You must call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.UpdateBoldedDates%2A> method afterward to update the display.
To add multiple dates in a single assignment, you can assign an array of <xref:System.DateTime> objects to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.BoldedDates%2A> property.
The date to be displayed in bold.
Adds a day that is displayed in bold on a monthly basis in the month calendar.
You must call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.UpdateBoldedDates%2A> method afterward to update the display.
To add multiple dates in a single assignment, you can assign an array of <xref:System.DateTime> objects to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.MonthlyBoldedDates%2A> property.
The date to be displayed in bold.
Gets or sets the array of <xref href="System.DateTime"></xref> objects that determines which annual days are displayed in bold.
Using this property, you can assign an array of annual bold dates.
When you assign an array of dates, the existing dates are first cleared.
An array of <xref href="System.DateTime"></xref> objects.
Gets or sets the background color for the control.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.BackColor%2A> property does not support transparent colors unless the `SupportsTransparentBackColor` value of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ControlStyles?displayProperty=fullName> is set to `true`.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.BackColor%2A> property is an ambient property.
An ambient property is a control property that, if not set, is retrieved from the parent control.
For example, a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Button> will have the same <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.BackColor%2A> as its parent <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form> by default.
For more information about ambient properties, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AmbientProperties> class or the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> class overview.
Starting with Windows Vista and depending on the theme, setting this property might not change the appearance of the calendar.
For example, if Windows is set to use the Aero theme, setting this property has no effect.
This is because an updated version of the calendar is rendered with an appearance that is derived at run time from the current operating system theme.
If you want to use this property and enable the earlier version of the calendar, you can disable visual styles for your application.
Disabling visual styles might affect the appearance and behavior of other controls in your application.
To disable visual styles in Visual Basic, open the Project Designer and uncheck the **Enable XP visual styles** check box.
To disable visual styles in C#, open Program.cs and comment out `Application.EnableVisualStyles();`.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> that represents the background color of the control.
The default is the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.DefaultBackColor"></xref> property.
Gets or sets the background image for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar"></xref>
This property is not relevant for this class.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Image"></xref> that is the background image for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar"></xref> control.
Occurs when the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.BackgroundImage"></xref> property changes.
Gets or sets a value indicating the layout for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.BackgroundImage"></xref>.
This property is not relevant for this class.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ImageLayout"></xref> values.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.BackgroundImageLayout"></xref> property changes.
Gets or sets the array of <xref href="System.DateTime"></xref> objects that determines which nonrecurring dates are displayed in bold.
Using this property, you can assign an array of bold dates.
When you assign an array of dates, the existing dates are first cleared.
The array of bold dates.
Gets or sets the number of columns and rows of months displayed.
Only one calendar year is displayed at a time, and the maximum number of months that can be displayed is 12.
Valid combinations of columns and rows make a maximum product of 12; for values greater than 12, the display is modified on a best-fit basis.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Size"></xref> with the number of columns and rows to use to display the calendar.
Occurs when the user clicks the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar"></xref> control.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar> control sets the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ControlStyles.StandardClick> bit flag to `false`, so the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar> will not raise the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.Click> event.
Overrides the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.CreateHandle"></xref> method.
Gets a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.CreateParams"></xref> for creating a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar"></xref> control.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.CreateParams%2A> property is called when a window is created.
Inheriting classes can override this property to add extra functionality, but you should first call `base.getCreateParams()` to make sure the control continues to work correctly.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.CreateParams"></xref> with the information for creating a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar"></xref> control.
Occurs when the date selected in the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar"></xref> changes.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.DateChanged> event occurs during any date selection, whether by mouse, keyboard, or code.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.DateSelected> event is similar, but it occurs only at the end of a date selection made using the mouse.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
Occurs when the user makes an explicit date selection using the mouse.
This event is similar to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.DateChanged> event, but it occurs at the end of a date selection made using the mouse.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.DateChanged> event occurs during any date selection, whether by mouse, keyboard, or code.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
Gets a value indicating the input method editor for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar"></xref>.
As implemented for this object, always <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ImeMode.Disable"></xref>.
Gets the default margin settings for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar"></xref> control.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Padding"></xref> structure with a padding size of 9 pixels, for all of its edges.
Gets the default size of the calendar.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.DefaultSize%2A> property includes the area necessary to display the "Today:" date at the bottom of the calendar.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Size"></xref> specifying the height and width, in pixels, of the control.
Overrides the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.DefWndProc(System.Windows.Forms.Message@)"></xref> method.
The Windows <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Message"></xref> to process.
Releases all resources used by the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar"></xref>.
This method is called by the public `Dispose()` method and the <xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> method.
`Dispose()` invokes the protected `Dispose(Boolean)` method with the `disposing` parameter set to `true`.
<xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> invokes `Dispose` with `disposing` set to `false`.
When the `disposing` parameter is true, this method releases all resources held by any managed objects that this <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar> references.
This method invokes the `Dispose()` method of each referenced object.
`true` to release both managed and unmanaged resources; `false` to release only unmanaged resources.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the control should redraw its surface using a secondary buffer.
Setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.DoubleBuffered%2A> property has no effect on the appearance of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar> control.
`true` if the control should use a secondary buffer to redraw; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Occurs when the user double-clicks the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar"></xref> control.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar> control sets the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ControlStyles.StandardClick> bit flag to `false`, so the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar> will not raise the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.DoubleClick> event.
Gets or sets the first day of the week as displayed in the month calendar.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Day"></xref> values.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Day.Default"></xref>.
The assigned value is not one of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Day"></xref> enumeration members.
Gets or sets the foreground color of the control.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ForeColor%2A> property is an ambient property.
An ambient property is a control property that, if not set, is retrieved from the parent control.
For example, a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Button> will have the same <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.BackColor%2A> as its parent <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form> by default.
For more information about ambient properties, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AmbientProperties> class or the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> class overview.
Starting with Windows Vista and depending on the theme, setting this property might not change the appearance of the calendar.
For example, if Windows is set to use the Aero theme, setting this property has no effect.
This is because an updated version of the calendar is rendered with an appearance that is derived at run time from the current operating system theme.
If you want to use this property and enable the earlier version of the calendar, you can disable visual styles for your application.
Disabling visual styles might affect the appearance and behavior of other controls in your application.
To disable visual styles in Visual Basic, open the Project Designer and uncheck the **Enable XP visual styles** check box.
To disable visual styles in C#, open Program.cs and comment out `Application.EnableVisualStyles();`.
The foreground <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> of the control.
The default is the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.DefaultForeColor"></xref> property.
Retrieves date information that represents the low and high limits of the displayed dates of the control.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.GetDisplayRange%2A> method returns a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.SelectionRange%2A> that contains the begin and end dates displayed in the current view of the control.
You can modify the returned range based on the value you specify for the `visible` parameter.
By specifying `false`, you can retrieve all dates displayed on the control; specifying `true` retrieves only those dates that are part of fully displayed months.
`true` to retrieve only the dates that are fully contained in displayed months; otherwise, `false`.
The begin and end dates of the displayed calendar.
Returns an object with information on which portion of a month calendar control is at a location specified by a <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> containing the <xref href="System.Drawing.Point.X"></xref> and <xref href="System.Drawing.Point.Y"></xref> coordinates of the point to be hit tested.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.HitTestInfo"></xref> that contains information about the specified point on the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar"></xref>.
Returns a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.HitTestInfo"></xref> with information on which portion of a month calendar control is at a specified x- and y-coordinate.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Point.X"></xref> coordinate of the point to be hit tested.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Point.Y"></xref> coordinate of the point to be hit tested.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.HitTestInfo"></xref> that contains information about the specified point on the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar"></xref>.
Gets or sets the Input Method Editor (IME) mode supported by this control.
This property is not relevant for this class.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ImeMode"></xref> values.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.ImeMode"></xref> property has changed.
Determines whether the specified key is a regular input key or a special key that requires preprocessing.
One of the Keys values.
`true` if the specified key is a regular input key; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets the maximum allowable date.
A <xref href="System.DateTime"></xref> representing the maximum allowable date.
The default is 12/31/9998.
The value is less than the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.MinDate"></xref>.
Gets or sets the maximum number of days that can be selected in a month calendar control.
Setting this property does not effect the current selection range.

It is important to remember that the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.MaxSelectionCount%2A> property represents the number of days in the selection, not the difference between <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.SelectionStart%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.SelectionEnd%2A>.

For example, if <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.MaxSelectionCount%2A> is 7 (the default), <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.SelectionStart%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.SelectionEnd%2A> can be no more than six days apart.
The maximum number of days that you can select.
The default is 7.
The value is less than 1.
-or-
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.MaxSelectionCount"></xref> cannot be set.
Gets or sets the minimum allowable date.
A <xref href="System.DateTime"></xref> representing the minimum allowable date.
The default is 01/01/1753.
The date set is greater than the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.MaxDate"></xref>.
-or-
The date set is earlier than 01/01/1753.
Gets or sets the array of <xref href="System.DateTime"></xref> objects that determine which monthly days to bold.
Using this property, you assign an array of monthly bold dates.
When you assign an array of dates, any preexisting dates are cleared.
An array of <xref href="System.DateTime"></xref> objects.
Occurs when the user clicks the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar"></xref> control with the mouse.
Occurs when the user double-clicks the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar"></xref> control with the mouse.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.BackColorChanged"></xref> event.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.DateChanged"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.OnDateChanged%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DateRangeEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.DateSelected"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.OnDateSelected%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DateRangeEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.FontChanged"></xref> event.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.OnFontChanged%2A> method resizes the control based on the new font size.
This can cause the calendar to overlap other controls on the form if the potential sizing issues have not been taken into account.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.OnFontChanged%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.ForeColorChanged"></xref> event.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.HandleCreated"></xref> event.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.HandleDestroyed"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.OnHandleDestroyed%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.RightToLeftLayoutChanged"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.OnRightToLeftLayoutChanged%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Gets or sets the space between the edges of a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar"></xref> control and its contents.
Setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.Padding%2A> property will have no effect on the appearance of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar>.
<xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Padding.Empty"></xref> in all cases.
Occurs when the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.Padding"></xref> property changes.
This event is not relevant for this class.
Example
Occurs when the control is redrawn.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar> control sets the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ControlStyles.UserPaint> bit flag to `false`, so the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar> will not raise the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.Paint> event.

To provide a custom look to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar> control, you should override the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.OnPrint%2A> method, call the base implementation of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.OnPrint%2A>, and then perform custom painting.
Removes all the annually bold dates.
This method clears all dates from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.AnnuallyBoldedDates%2A> array.
To remove a single date from the bold dates, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.RemoveAnnuallyBoldedDate%2A> method.
You must call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.UpdateBoldedDates%2A> method to ensure that the display is updated to reflect the removal.
Removes all the nonrecurring bold dates.
This method clears the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.BoldedDates%2A> array.
To remove a single date from the bold dates, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.RemoveBoldedDate%2A> method.
You must call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.UpdateBoldedDates%2A> method to ensure that the display is updated to reflect the removal.
Removes all the monthly bold dates.
This method clears the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.MonthlyBoldedDates%2A> array.
To remove a single date from the bold dates, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.RemoveMonthlyBoldedDate%2A> method.
You must call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.UpdateBoldedDates%2A> method to ensure that the display is updated to reflect the removal.
Removes the specified date from the list of annually bold dates.
If the specified date occurs more than once in the date list, only the first date is removed.
When comparing dates, only the day and month are used.
You must call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.UpdateBoldedDates%2A> method to ensure that the display is updated to reflect the removal.
The date to remove from the date list.
Removes the specified date from the list of nonrecurring bold dates.
If the specified date occurs more than once in the date list, only the first date is removed.
You must call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.UpdateBoldedDates%2A> method to ensure that the display is updated to reflect the removal.
The date to remove from the date list.
Removes the specified date from the list of monthly bolded dates.
If the specified date occurs more than once in the date list, only the first date is removed.
When comparing dates, only the day and month are used.
You must call <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.UpdateBoldedDates%2A> to ensure that the display is updated to reflect the removal.
The date to remove from the date list.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the control is laid out from right to left.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.RightToLeftLayout%2A> property is useful for international applications where the language is written from right to left.
When the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.RightToLeft%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.RightToLeftLayout%2A> properties are both `true`,
Mirroring will be turned on for the form, and control placement and text will be from right to left.
`true` if the control is laid out from right to left; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Occurs when the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.RightToLeftLayout"></xref> property changes.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
Gets or sets the scroll rate for a month calendar control.
The scroll rate is the number of months that the control moves its display when the user clicks a scroll arrow.
If this value is 0, the number of months is reset to the default, which is the number of months displayed in the control.
The maximum value is 20,000.
A positive number representing the current scroll rate in number of months moved.
The default is the number of months currently displayed.
The maximum is 20,000.
The value is less than 0.
-or-
The value is greater than 20,000.
Gets or sets the end date of the selected range of dates.

If you set the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.SelectionEnd%2A> property to a date that is earlier than the current value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.SelectionStart%2A> property, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.SelectionStart%2A> is automatically set equal to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.SelectionEnd%2A>.

If you set a date in <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.SelectionEnd%2A> that causes the selection to exceed the number of days specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.MaxSelectionCount%2A> property, the value of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.SelectionStart%2A> is adjusted; <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.SelectionStart%2A> is automatically set so that the number of days selected is equal to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.MaxSelectionCount%2A>.

<xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.MaxSelectionCount%2A> represents the number of days in the selection, not the difference between <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.SelectionStart%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.SelectionEnd%2A>.

For example, if <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.MaxSelectionCount%2A> is 7 (the default), then <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.SelectionStart%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.SelectionEnd%2A> can be no more than six days apart.

Setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.SelectionRange%2A> for a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar> control that has visual styles enabled will result in the selection range not painting correctly on the control.
A <xref href="System.DateTime"></xref> indicating the last date in the selection range.
The date value is less than the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.MinDate"></xref> value.
-or-
The date value is greater than the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.MaxDate"></xref> value.
Gets or sets the selected range of dates for a month calendar control.
Setting this property is functionally equivalent to using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.SetSelectionRange%2A> method.

You can set the start and end dates separately by setting either the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.SelectionStart%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.SelectionEnd%2A> properties.

You cannot change the start and end dates by setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange.Start%2A?displayProperty=fullName> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange.End%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property values of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.SelectionRange%2A> property.

You should use <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.SelectionStart%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.SelectionEnd%2A>, or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.SetSelectionRange%2A>.

If the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange.Start%2A> property value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange> is greater than its <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange.End%2A> property value, the dates are swapped; the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange.End%2A> property value becomes the starting date, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange.Start%2A> property value becomes the end date.
Scrolling through the calendar display with the navigation buttons when a range is selected can cause unexpected results (for example, the date range is not preserved).
If you have a single month displayed with a range of 04/01/2001 to 04/10/2001, scrolling the calendar to March changes the selected range as follows: 03/01/2001 to 03/10/2001.

If you have multiple months displayed, such as March and April with a selected range of 04/01/2001 to 04/10/2001, scrolling the calendar back to January and February changes the selected range as follows: 01/01/2001 to 01/10/2001.

Setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.SelectionRange%2A> for a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar> control that has visual styles enabled will result in the selection range not painting correctly on the control.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange"></xref> with the start and end dates of the selected range.

The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange.Start"></xref> value of the assigned <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange"></xref> is less than the minimum date allowable for a month calendar control.
-or-

The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange.Start"></xref> value of the assigned <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange"></xref> is greater than the maximum allowable date for a month calendar control.
-or-

The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange.End"></xref> value of the assigned <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange"></xref> is less than the minimum date allowable for a month calendar control.
-or-

The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange.End"></xref> value of the assigned <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange"></xref> is greater than the maximum allowable date for a month calendar control.
Gets or sets the start date of the selected range of dates.

If you set the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.SelectionStart%2A> property to a date that is later than the current value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.SelectionEnd%2A> property, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.SelectionEnd%2A> is automatically set equal to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.SelectionStart%2A>.

If you set a date in <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.SelectionStart%2A> that causes the selection to exceed the number of days specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.MaxSelectionCount%2A> property, the value of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.SelectionEnd%2A> is adjusted; <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.SelectionEnd%2A> is automatically set so that the number of days selected is equal to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.MaxSelectionCount%2A>.

<xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.MaxSelectionCount%2A> represents the number of days in the selection, not the difference between <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.SelectionStart%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.SelectionEnd%2A>.

For example, if <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.MaxSelectionCount%2A> is 7 (the default), then <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.SelectionStart%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.SelectionEnd%2A> can be no more than six days apart.

Setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.SelectionRange%2A> for a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar> control that has visual styles enabled will result in the selection range not painting correctly on the control.
A <xref href="System.DateTime"></xref> indicating the first date in the selection range.
The date value is less than <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.MinDate"></xref>.
-or-
The date value is greater than <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.MaxDate"></xref>.
Overrides the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.SetBoundsCore(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Windows.Forms.BoundsSpecified)"></xref> method.
The new <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.Left"></xref> property value of the control.
The new <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.Right"></xref> property value of the control.
The new <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.Width"></xref> property value of the control.
The new <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.Height"></xref> property value of the control.
A bitwise combination of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.BoundsSpecified"></xref> values.
Sets the number of columns and rows of months to display.
The maximum number of months that you can display is 12, restricted to one calendar year.
The product of the `x` and `y` parameters should be 12 or less.
For values of `x` and `y` that have a product of more than 12, the greater of the `x` and `y` values will be iteratively reduced until the product is 12 or less.
The number of columns.
The number of rows.
x or y is less than 1.
Sets a date as the currently selected date.
This method sets the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.SelectionStart%2A> and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.SelectionEnd%2A> properties to the specified date.

This method is the functional equivalent of setting the selection range to a single day through the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.SetSelectionRange%2A> method or the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.SelectionRange%2A> property.
The date to be selected.
The value is less than the minimum allowable date.
-or-
The value is greater than the maximum allowable date.
This exception will only be thrown if <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.MinDate"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.MaxDate"></xref> have been set explicitly.
Sets the selected dates in a month calendar control to the specified date range.
Using this method is functionally equivalent to setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.SelectionRange%2A> property.
You can set the start and end dates separately by setting either the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.SelectionStart%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.SelectionEnd%2A> property.
If you set the `date1` parameter greater than the `date2` parameter, both dates are set to the `date1` value.
Scrolling through the calendar display with the navigation buttons when a range is selected can cause unexpected results (for example, the date range is not preserved).
If you have a single month displayed with a range of 04/01/2001 to 04/10/2001, scrolling the calendar back changes the selected range as follows: 03/01/2001 to 03/10/2001.

If you have multiple months displayed, such as March and April with a selected range of 04/01/2001 to 04/10/2001, scrolling the calendar back to January and February changes the selected range as follows: 01/01/2001 to 01/10/2001.

Setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.SelectionRange%2A> for a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar> control that has visual styles enabled will result in the selection range not painting correctly on the control.
The beginning date of the selection range.
The end date of the selection range.
date1 is less than the minimum date allowable for a month calendar control.
-or-
date1 is greater than the maximum allowable date for a month calendar control.
-or-
date2 is less than the minimum date allowable for a month calendar control.
-or-
date2 is greater than the maximum allowable date for a month calendar control.
This exception will only be thrown if <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.MinDate"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.MaxDate"></xref> have been set explicitly.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the date represented by the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.TodayDate"></xref> property is displayed at the bottom of the control.
The date is displayed in the format specified by the system settings for the short date format.
`true` if today's date is displayed; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `true`.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether today's date is identified with a circle or a square.

If <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.ShowTodayCircle%2A> is `true`, and visual styles are enabled and supported on the computer running the application, today's date will be enclosed in a square, otherwise today's date will be circled.
`true` if today's date is identified with a circle or a square; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `true`.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the month calendar control displays week numbers (1-52) to the left of each row of days.
`true` if the week numbers are displayed; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Gets the minimum size to display one month of the calendar.

The size information is presented in the form of the <xref:System.Drawing.Size.Width%2A> and <xref:System.Drawing.Size.Height%2A> members, representing the minimum width and height required to display one month in the control.
The minimum required window size for a month calendar control depends on the currently selected font.
The size, in pixels, necessary to fully display one month in the calendar.
The dimensions cannot be retrieved.
Gets or sets the size of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar"></xref> control.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Size"></xref> of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar"></xref> control.
Gets or sets the text to display on the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar"></xref>.
This property is not relevant for this class.
`Null`.
Occurs when the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.Text"></xref> property changes.
Gets or sets a value indicating the background color of the title area of the calendar.
The font color of the days-of-the-week text depends on the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.TitleBackColor%2A> property.

Setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.TitleBackColor%2A> equal to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.BackColor%2A> for the main display area of the calendar causes the days-of-the-week text to become unreadable.
Starting with Windows Vista and depending on the theme, setting this property might not change the appearance of the calendar.
For example, if Windows is set to use the Aero theme, setting this property has no effect.
This is because an updated version of the calendar is rendered with an appearance that is derived at run time from the current operating system theme.
If you want to use this property and enable the earlier version of the calendar, you can disable visual styles for your application.
Disabling visual styles might affect the appearance and behavior of other controls in your application.
To disable visual styles in Visual Basic, open the Project Designer and uncheck the **Enable XP visual styles** check box.
To disable visual styles in C#, open Program.cs and comment out `Application.EnableVisualStyles();`.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref>.
The default is the system color for active captions.
The value is not a valid <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref>.
Gets or sets a value indicating the foreground color of the title area of the calendar.
Starting with Windows Vista and depending on the theme, setting this property might not change the appearance of the calendar.
For example, if Windows is set to use the Aero theme, setting this property has no effect.
This is because an updated version of the calendar is rendered with an appearance that is derived at run time from the current operating system theme.
If you want to use this property and enable the earlier version of the calendar, you can disable visual styles for your application.
Disabling visual styles might affect the appearance and behavior of other controls in your application.
To disable visual styles in Visual Basic, open the Project Designer and uncheck the **Enable XP visual styles** check box.
To disable visual styles in C#, open Program.cs and comment out `Application.EnableVisualStyles();`.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref>.
The default is the system color for active caption text.
The value is not a valid <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref>.
Gets or sets the value that is used by <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar"></xref> as today's date.
By default, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.TodayDate%2A> property returns the current system date, and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.TodayDateSet%2A> property is `false`.

Setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.TodayDate%2A> property sets the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.TodayDateSet%2A> property to `true` and, from that point, the value returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.TodayDate%2A> property is the one the user sets.
A <xref href="System.DateTime"></xref> representing today's date.
The default value is the current system date.
The value is less than the minimum allowable date.
-or-
The value is greater than the maximum allowable date.
Gets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.TodayDate"></xref> property has been explicitly set.
`true` if the value for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.TodayDate"></xref> property has been explicitly set; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Returns a string that represents the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar"></xref> control.
The string includes the type and the string returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange.ToString%2A> method of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.SelectionRange%2A> property.
A string that represents the current <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar"></xref>.
Gets or sets a value indicating the color of days in months that are not fully displayed in the control.
When the calendar is displayed, some dates precede and some follow the months that are fully displayed.
Using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.TrailingForeColor%2A> property, you can modify the color of the text for those dates.
Starting with Windows Vista and depending on the theme, setting this property might not change the appearance of the calendar.
For example, if Windows is set to use the Aero theme, setting this property has no effect.
This is because an updated version of the calendar is rendered with an appearance that is derived at run time from the current operating system theme.
If you want to use this property and enable the earlier version of the calendar, you can disable visual styles for your application.
Disabling visual styles might affect the appearance and behavior of other controls in your application.
To disable visual styles in Visual Basic, open the Project Designer and uncheck the **Enable XP visual styles** check box.
To disable visual styles in C#, open Program.cs and comment out `Application.EnableVisualStyles();`.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref>.
The default is <xref href="System.Drawing.Color.Gray"></xref>.
The value is not a valid <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref>.
Repaints the bold dates to reflect the dates set in the lists of bold dates.

Use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.UpdateBoldedDates%2A> method to reflect changes made to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.AnnuallyBoldedDates%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.MonthlyBoldedDates%2A>, or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.BoldedDates%2A> properties, either directly by modifying elements of the array or by using the add or remove methods provided to modify the date lists.
Overrides the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.WndProc(System.Windows.Forms.Message@)"></xref> method.
The Windows <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Message"></xref> to process.
